name: Order Domain
source: Guildmaster's Guide to Ravnica, Tasha's Cauldron of Everything
description: The Order Domain represents discipline and devotion to laws that govern society or philosophy. Clerics of Order believe that well-crafted laws create order and security, and those who lead must be obeyed. They focus on logic, justice, and the proper enforcement of laws.

bonus_proficiencies.description: Gain proficiency with heavy armor and in the Intimidation or Persuasion skill (your choice).

voice_of_authority.description: When you cast a spell with a spell slot of 1st level or higher and target an ally, that ally can use their reaction immediately to make one weapon attack against a creature you can see. You choose the ally if the spell targets more than one.

channel_divinity_orders_demand.description: As an action, present your holy symbol. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you until the end of your next turn or until it takes damage. Charmed creatures can also be forced to drop what they are holding.

embodiment_of_the_law.description: When you cast an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher, you can change its casting time to 1 bonus action, provided it normally takes 1 action. Use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once), and regain uses after a long rest.

divine_strike.description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, deal an extra 1d8 psychic damage. The extra damage increases to 2d8 at 14th level.

orders_wrath.description: If you deal Divine Strike damage to a creature, you can curse it until the start of your next turn. The next time an ally hits the cursed creature, it takes an additional 2d8 psychic damage. You can curse a creature this way only once per turn.
